body_html:
Fair, but it's usable in the same way:

a = torch.rand(3, 2)
print(a.size())
print(a.shape)
print(a.shape[-1])

torch.Size([3, 2])
torch.Size([3, 2])
2

I dont have any strong opinion on whether to convert it to a tuple or not. I suppose, now that you mention it, it's the sort of thing that will create weird inconsistencies down the line, if I dont change it to a tuple now?

body:
Fair, but it's usable in the same way:
```
a = torch.rand(3, 2)
print(a.size())
print(a.shape)
print(a.shape[-1])
```

```
torch.Size([3, 2])
torch.Size([3, 2])
2
```

I dont have any strong opinion on whether to convert it to a tuple or not. I suppose, now that you mention it, it's the sort of thing that will create weird inconsistencies down the line, if I dont change it to a tuple now?
